instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..
definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) - Touchbar no display / touch
threads.message:
Hi,

I have here an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Touchbar doesnt work. (no signs of life)

Note: J5100 was corroded - cleaned it and removed the corrosion. (Flexcable was fine) 

J5100 power lines:
- <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2RSW_DFR</SIGNAL>: 1.8V
- <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S_DFR_FILT</SIGNAL>: 5.1V

J5110 power lines:
- <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2RSW_DFR</SIGNAL>: 1.8V
- <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3HSW_DFR</SIGNAL>: 3.3V

Any idea? Is there something i missed?

Note: Sadly I dont have another topcase with a known good TB for testing.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) - Touchbar no display / touch
threads.message:
Check J5100 signals, pins 1, 2, 18.
Also check J5110, pins 10 & 12.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) - Touchbar no display / touch
threads.message:
[B]J5100:[/B]
- PIN1 "<SIGNAL>TP_DFR_TOUCH_PANEL_DETECT</SIGNAL>" : 0.03V | O.L. (no touchbar connected)
- PIN2 "<SIGNAL>DFR_LID_OPEN_L</SIGNAL>" :  0.0V | O.L. (no trackpad connected)
- PIN18 "<SIGNAL>DFR_TOUCH_RESET_L</SIGNAL>" :  0.05V | 0.466  (no touchbar connected)

[B]J5110:[/B]
- PIN10 "<SIGNAL>DFR_DISP_INT</SIGNAL>" : 0.0V | 0.470  (no touchbar connected)
- PIN12 "<SIGNAL>DFR_DISP_RESET_L</SIGNAL>" : 1.8V | 0.470  (no touchbar connected)

Note:
I have already tried DFU restore - no changes to the touchbar.

Note2:
TPC522 is gone - but connection between <RESISTOR>R5106</RESISTOR> and J5100 / PIN2 is fine.

Note3: 
ALS not working - Keyboard backlight is working.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) - Touchbar no display / touch
threads.message: Please, connect touchbar and found proper test points...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) - Touchbar no display / touch
threads.message:
[B]J5100:[/B]
- PIN1 "<SIGNAL>TP_DFR_TOUCH_PANEL_DETECT</SIGNAL>" : 1.8V
- PIN2 "<SIGNAL>DFR_LID_OPEN_L</SIGNAL>" : 1.4V
- PIN18 "<SIGNAL>DFR_TOUCH_RESET_L</SIGNAL>" :  0.04V

[B]J5110:[/B]
- PIN10 "<SIGNAL>DFR_DISP_INT</SIGNAL>" : 0.0V
- PIN12 "<SIGNAL>DFR_DISP_RESET_L</SIGNAL>" : 1.8V

(with touchbar and trackpad connected)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) - Touchbar no display / touch
threads.message:
Check these levels with another machine with touchbar.
No need to be exact same model; just compare same touchbar lines.
Also check them in diode mode.

Which pins of J5100 have been affected by corrosion?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) - Touchbar no display / touch
threads.message:
I will do.

The following PINs were affected:
- <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S_DFR_FILT</SIGNAL>
- <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2RSW_DFR</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) - Touchbar no display / touch
threads.message:
[B]J5100:[/B]
- PIN1 "<SIGNAL>TP_DFR_TOUCH_PANEL_DETECT</SIGNAL>" : 1.8V
- PIN2 "<SIGNAL>DFR_LID_OPEN_L</SIGNAL>" : 1.4V
- PIN18 "<SIGNAL>DFR_TOUCH_RESET_L</SIGNAL>" : 0.04V

[B]J5110:[/B]
- PIN10 "<SIGNAL>DFR_DISP_INT</SIGNAL>" : 0.0V
- PIN12 "<SIGNAL>DFR_DISP_RESET_L</SIGNAL>" : 1.8V

Update: I have compared the values (to a known good board / different model) - same behavior.

I also noticed that " PIN18 "<SIGNAL>DFR_TOUCH_RESET_L</SIGNAL>" is during boot like 2-3 seconds on 1.8V then it drops down to 0.04V.

So I guess the board is fine? And just the TB dead?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) - Touchbar no display / touch
threads.message: Changing touchbar is the best option here.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) - Touchbar no display / touch
threads.message: Ok, what about the ALS issue? (display brightness is not adjusting)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) - Touchbar no display / touch
threads.message: Test the machine disconnecting camera flex from T-CON board.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) - Touchbar no display / touch
threads.message:
TB is now working.
After reconnecting the flex all (TB, camera and ALS) is working again - what the hell?

Edit:
Sometimes itâ€™s working sometimes not.

Edit2:
ALS and camera is always working - TB is now dark again.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) - Touchbar no display / touch
threads.message:
Only lose the touchbar backlight, or touch functions too?
Clean the connectors; be sure to get good contact.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) - Touchbar no display / touch
threads.message: Reflow of the J5100 solved the issue - thanks for your help.
